input.description: The name of the adapter to use to handle the request. Default adapter name: MSSCCMActor.

Sample items Xml:
<items> <item> <target>config1</target>
<software-updates-search-criteria> <software-name></software-name> <ci-id></ci-id> <ci-unique-id></ci-unique-id> <bulletin-id></bulletin-id> <kb-article-id></kb-article-id> <severity></severity> </software-updates-search-criteria>
<deployment-name></deployment-name> <deployment-description></deployment-description> <collection-id>PRI00022</collection-id> <deployment-type></deployment-type> <send-wakeup-packets></send-wakeup-packets> <state-message-detail-level></state-message-detail-level> <dp-locality></dp-locality> <use-gmt-times></use-gmt-times> <start-time></start-time> <enforcement-deadline></enforcement-deadline> <notify-user></notify-user> <user-ui-experience></user-ui-experience>
<allow-activities-outside-maintenance-window> <software-updates-installation></software-updates-installation> <system-restart></system-restart> </allow-activities-outside-maintenance-window>
<suppress-reboot></suppress-reboot>
<non-compliance-criticality></non-compliance-criticality> <send-detailed-non-compliance-status></send-detailed-non-compliance-status> <log-compliance-to-win-event></log-compliance-to-win-event>
<disable-mom-alerts></disable-mom-alerts> <raise-mom-alerts-on-failure></raise-mom-alerts-on-failure>
</item> </items>
Elements' Description:
item [Required] This is a child tag of <items> tag. The <item> tag can be specified multiple times to support "multiple items support".
target [Optional]: This element to specify the connection information for the Microsoft System Center Configuration Manager application.
Valid values: The value specified for <target> XML element must be same as the value that has been specified for the name attribute of <config> element in Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Default value: If this element is not provided or left empty, the request will be executed on the first defined Grid Manager adapter configuration.
Note: The value of this tag is case sensitive.
software-updates-search-criteria [Required]
An element to enclose Software Updates Search criteria elements - <software-name>, <ci-id>, <ci-unique-id>, <bulletin-id>, <kb-article-id> and <severity>
Note: One of the six search criteria elements - <software-name>, <ci-id>, <ci-unique-id>, <bulletin-id>, <kb-article-id> and <severity> is required.
software-name [Optional] The localized display name of the Software Update to be searched and deployed.
ci-id [Optional] The unique ID of the configuration item (Software Updates in this case) to search. This ID is unique only for the site.
ci-unique-id [Optional]
The unique ID of the configuration item (Software Update) to be searched. This ID is unique across sites.
bulletin-id [Optional] Bulletin ID for security updates released by Microsoft. The maximum length for this value is 64 characters.
kb-article-id [Optional] Knowledge base article ID to perform search on the software updates. The maximum length for this value is 64 characters.
severity [Optional] Severity Name to perform search on the software updates.
Valid values: - Critical - Moderate - Important - None
deployment-name [Required] A logical name given to the Software Updates Deployment Assignment.
deployment-description [Optional] Description for the Software Updates Deployment Assignment.
collection-id [Required] The Collection Id to which the Software Updates need to be deployed.
deployment-type [Required] Indicates whether the deployment is required or not.
Valid values: - Required - Available
send-wakeup-packets [Optional] Indicates whether to send a Wake On Lan (WoL) transmission to the client when the deadline is reached for the assignment.
Valid values are: - True - False
Note: Valid only when the 'type' of the Software Updates Deployment is 'Required'
state-message-detail-level [Optional]
Indicates the level of the state messages sent to the user. Valid values are:
- None - Errors - Successes - All (default)
dp-locality [Optional] Flags that determine how the client obtains distribution points, according to distribution point locality.
Possible values are: - DP_DOWNLOAD_FROM_LOCAL (Default) - DP_DOWNLOAD_FROM_REMOTE - DP_NO_FALLBACK_UNPROTECTED - DP_ALLOW_WUMU - DP_ALLOW_METERED_NETWORK
use-gmt-times [Optional] Flag to indicate if the time values specified are in Universal Coordinated Time (UTC). The default value is 'False'.
start-time [Required] The date and time when the configuration item Software Updates Deployment Assignment is to be offered.
Format: YYYYmmDDhhMMss.MMMMMM+***
enforcement-deadline [Required The date and time when the configuration item assignment will be enforced.
Format: YYYYmmDDhhMMss.MMMMMM+***
notify-user [Optional] Flag to indicate whether to notify the user when a configuration item is available. The default value is 'False'.
user-ui-experience [Optional] Indicates if user notification is displayed. The default value is 'False'.
allow-activities-outside-maintenance-window [Optional] This element contains child elements to indicate activities that a client can perform on reaching the deadline.
software-updates-installation [Optional] Indicates whether a client should install the Software Update.
Note: Valid only when the 'type' of the deployment is 'Required'
system-restart [Optional] Indicates whether a client should restart the device after the installation.
Note: Valid only when the 'type' of the deployment is 'Required'
suppress-reboot [Required] Value indicating whether the client should not reboot the computer, if there is a reboot pending after the configuration item is applied.
Possible values are:
- SUPPRESS_REBOOT_WORKSTATIONS - SUPPRESS_REBOOT_SERVERS
non-compliance-criticality [Optional] The application's non-compliance criticality for the assignment.
Valid values: Any value from 0 to 99
send-detailed-non-compliance-status [Optional] Flag to indicate whether to send a detailed non-compliance status message. The default value is 'False'.
log-compliance-to-win-event [Optional] Flag to indicate whether to log compliance status to Windows event logs. The default value is 'False'.
disable-mom-alerts [Optional] Indicates if the client is configured to raise MOM alerts when the application is applied. The default value is 'False'.
raise-mom-alerts-on-failure [Optional] Flag to indicate whether the client should raise MOM alerts if it fails to apply a configuration item. The default value is 'False'.

output.description: Returned adapter response is captured in this context parameter.
